intro: Nemepis americana, commonly known as the American nemesis, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheats and sorrels. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, triangular leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences and are typically greenish-white in color. Nemepis americana thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found along stream banks and in open woodlands.
